api_key_endpoint.description: Endpoint to use when authenticating with an API key outside of Spacelift

api_key_id.description: ID of the API key to use when executing outside of Spacelift

api_key_secret.description: API key secret to use when executing outside of Spacelift

api_token.description: Spacelift token generated by a run, only useful from within Spacelift

custom_headers.description: `custom_headers` is a Map of key-value strings, that will be passed as headers with audit trail requests.

enabled.description: `enabled` determines whether the webhook is enabled. If it is not, Spacelift will not send any requests to the endpoint.

endpoint.description: `endpoint` is the URL to which Spacelift will send POST requests about audit events.

include_runs.description: `include_runs` determines whether the webhook should include information about the run that triggered the event.

secret.description: `secret` is a secret that Spacelift will send with the request. Note that once it's created, it will be just an empty string in the state due to security reasons.

block.description: `spacelift_audit_trail_webhook` represents a webhook endpoint to which Spacelift sends POST requests about audit events.

duration_seconds.description: Duration in seconds for which the assumed role credentials should be valid. Defaults to `900`.

external_id.description: Custom external ID (works only for private workers).

generate_credentials_in_worker.description: Generate AWS credentials in the private worker. Defaults to `false`.

labels.description: Labels to set on the integration

name.description: The friendly name of the integration

region.description: AWS region to select a regional AWS STS endpoint.

role_arn.description: ARN of the AWS IAM role to attach

space_id.description: ID (slug) of the space the integration is in

block.description:
`spacelift_aws_integration` represents an integration with an AWS account. This integration is account-level and needs to be explicitly attached to individual stacks in order to take effect.

Note: when assuming credentials for **shared workers**, Spacelift will use `$accountName@$integrationID@$stackID@$suffix` or `$accountName@$integrationID@$moduleID@$suffix` as [external ID](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_create_for-user_externalid.html) and `$runID@$stackID@$accountName` truncated to 64 characters as [session ID](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/STS/latest/APIReference/API_AssumeRole),$suffix will be `read` or `write`.

attachment_id.description: Internal ID of the attachment entity

integration_id.description: ID of the integration to attach

module_id.description: ID of the module to attach the integration to

read.description: Indicates whether this attachment is used for read operations. Defaults to `true`.

stack_id.description: ID of the stack to attach the integration to

write.description: Indicates whether this attachment is used for write operations. Defaults to `true`.

block.description: `spacelift_aws_integration_attachment` represents the attachment between a reusable AWS integration and a single stack or module.

duration_seconds.description: AWS IAM role session duration in seconds

external_id.description: Custom external ID (works only for private workers).

generate_credentials_in_worker.description: Generate AWS credentials in the private worker. Defaults to `false`.

module_id.description: ID of the module which assumes the AWS IAM role

region.description: AWS region to select a regional AWS STS endpoint.

role_arn.description: ARN of the AWS IAM role to attach

stack_id.description: ID of the stack which assumes the AWS IAM role

block.description:
**NOTE:** while this resource continues to work, we have replaced it with the `spacelift_aws_integration` resource. The new resource allows integrations to be shared by multiple stacks/modules and also supports separate read vs write roles. Please use the `spacelift_aws_integration` resource instead.

`spacelift_aws_role` represents [cross-account IAM role delegation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/tutorial_cross-account-with-roles.html) between the Spacelift worker and an individual stack or module. If this is set, Spacelift will use AWS STS to assume the supplied IAM role and put its temporary credentials in the runtime environment.

If you use private workers, you can also assume IAM role on the worker side using your own AWS credentials (e.g. from EC2 instance profile).

Note: when assuming credentials for **shared worker**, Spacelift will use `$accountName@$stackID` or `$accountName@$moduleID` as [external ID](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_create_for-user_externalid.html) and `$runID@$stackID@$accountName` truncated to 64 characters as [session ID](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/STS/latest/APIReference/API_AssumeRole).

admin_consent_provided.description: Indicates whether admin consent has been performed for the AAD Application.

admin_consent_url.description: The URL to use to provide admin consent to the application in the customer's tenant

application_id.description: The applicationId of the Azure AD application used by the integration.

default_subscription_id.description: The default subscription ID to use, if one isn't specified at the stack/module level

display_name.description: The display name for the application in Azure. This is automatically generated when the integration is created, and cannot be changed without deleting and recreating the integration.

labels.description: Labels to set on the integration

name.description: The friendly name of the integration

space_id.description: ID (slug) of the space the integration is in

block.description: `spacelift_azure_integration` represents an integration with an Azure AD tenant. This integration is account-level and needs to be explicitly attached to individual stacks in order to take effect. Note that you will need to provide admin consent manually for the integration to work

attachment_id.description: Internal ID of the attachment entity

integration_id.description: ID of the integration to attach

module_id.description: ID of the module to attach the integration to

read.description: Indicates whether this attachment is used for read operations. Defaults to `true`.

stack_id.description: ID of the stack to attach the integration to

subscription_id.description: Contains the Azure subscription ID to use with this Stack.  Overrides the default subscription ID set at the integration level.

write.description: Indicates whether this attachment is used for write operations. Defaults to `true`.

block.description: `spacelift_azure_integration_attachment` represents the attachment between a reusable Azure integration and a single stack or module.

api_host.description: The API host where requests will be sent

id.description: Bitbucket Datacenter integration id.

space_id.description: Bitbucket Datacenter integration space id. Defaults to `root`.

user_facing_host.description: User Facing Host which will be used for all user-facing URLs displayed in the Spacelift UI

username.description: Username which will be used to authenticate requests for cloning repositories

vcs_checks.description: VCS checks configured for Bitbucket Datacenter repositories. Possible values: INDIVIDUAL, AGGREGATED, ALL. Defaults to INDIVIDUAL.

webhook_secret.description: Secret for webhooks originating from Bitbucket repositories

webhook_url.description: URL for webhooks originating from Bitbucket repositories

block.description: `spacelift_bitbucket_datacenter_integration` represents details of a bitbucket datacenter integration

space.description: ID of the space the blueprint is in

state.description: State of the blueprint. Value can be `DRAFT` or `PUBLISHED`.

template.description: Body of the blueprint. If `state` is set to `PUBLISHED`, this field is required.

block.description: `spacelift_blueprint` represents a Spacelift blueprint, which allows you to easily create stacks using a templating engine. For Terraform users it's preferable to use `spacelift_stack` instead. This resource is mostly useful for those who do not use Terraform to create stacks.

labels.description: The labels of the context. To leverage the `autoattach` magic label, ensure your label follows the naming convention: `autoattach:<your-label-name>`

name.description: Name of the context - should be unique in one account

space_id.description: ID (slug) of the space the context is in

block.description: `spacelift_context` represents a Spacelift **context** - a collection of configuration elements (either environment variables or mounted files) that can be administratively attached to multiple stacks (`spacelift_stack`) or modules (`spacelift_module`) using a context attachment (`spacelift_context_attachment`)`

context_id.description: ID of the context to attach

module_id.description: ID of the module to attach the context to

priority.description: Priority of the context attachment. All the contexts attached to a stack are sorted by priority (lowest first), though values don't need to be unique. This ordering establishes precedence rules between contexts should there be a conflict and multiple contexts define the same value. Defaults to `0`.

stack_id.description: ID of the stack to attach the context to

block.description: `spacelift_context_attachment` represents a Spacelift attachment of a single context to a single stack or module, with a predefined priority.

ignore_state.description: Controls whether drift detection should be performed on a stack in any final state instead of just 'Finished'.

reconcile.description: Whether a tracked run should be triggered when drift is detected.

schedule.description: List of cron schedule expressions based on which drift detection should be triggered.

stack_id.description: ID of the stack for which to set up drift detection

timezone.description: Timezone in which the schedule is expressed. Defaults to `UTC`.

block.description: `spacelift_drift_detection` represents a Drift Detection configuration for a Stack. It will trigger a proposed run on the given schedule, which you can listen for using run state webhooks. If reconcile is true, then a tracked run will be triggered when drift is detected.

context_id.description: ID of the context on which the environment variable is defined

module_id.description: ID of the module on which the environment variable is defined

stack_id.description: ID of the stack on which the environment variable is defined

value.description: Value of the environment variable. Defaults to an empty string.

write_only.description: Indicates whether the value is secret or not. Defaults to `true`.

block.description: `spacelift_environment_variable` defines an environment variable on the context (`spacelift_context`), stack (`spacelift_stack`) or a module (`spacelift_module`), thereby allowing to pass and share various secrets and configuration with Spacelift stacks.

module_id.description: ID of the module which uses GCP service account credentials

service_account_email.description: Email address of the GCP service account dedicated for this stack

stack_id.description: ID of the stack which uses GCP service account credentials

token_scopes.description: List of scopes that will be requested when generating temporary GCP service account credentials

block.description: `spacelift_gcp_service_account` represents a Google Cloud Platform service account that's linked to a particular Stack or Module. These accounts are created by Spacelift on per-stack basis, and can be added as members to as many organizations and projects as needed. During a Run or a Task, temporary credentials for those service accounts are injected into the environment, which allows credential-less GCP Terraform provider setup.

id.description: GitLab integration id.

is_default.description: Is the GitLab integration the default for all spaces? If set to `true` the space must be set to `root` in `space_id` or left empty which uses the default

labels.description: Labels to set on the integration

name.description: The friendly name of the integration

space_id.description: ID (slug) of the space the integration is in; Default: `root`

vcs_checks.description: VCS checks configured for GitLab repositories. Possible values: INDIVIDUAL, AGGREGATED, ALL. Defaults to INDIVIDUAL.

webhook_secret.description: Secret for webhooks originating from GitLab repositories

webhook_url.description: URL for webhooks originating from GitLab repositories

block.description: `spacelift_gitlab_integration` represents an integration with a GitLab instance

name.description: Name of the user group - should be unique in one account

role.description: Type of access to the space. Possible values are: READ, WRITE, ADMIN

space_id.description: ID (slug) of the space the user group has access to

block.description: `spacelift_idp_group_mapping` represents a mapping (binding) between a user group (as provided by IdP) and a Spacelift User Management Policy. If you assign permissions (a Policy) to a user group, all users in the group will have those permissions unless the user's permissions are higher than the group's permissions.

administrative.description: Indicates whether this module can manage others. Defaults to `false`.

aws_assume_role_policy_statement.description: AWS IAM assume role policy statement setting up trust relationship

branch.description: GitHub branch to apply changes to

enable_local_preview.description: Indicates whether local preview versions can be triggered on this Module. Defaults to `false`.

name.description: The module name will by default be inferred from the repository name if it follows the terraform-provider-name naming convention. However, if the repository doesn't follow this convention, or you want to give it a custom name, you can provide it here.

project_root.description: Project root is the optional directory relative to the repository root containing the module source code.

protect_from_deletion.description: Protect this module from accidental deletion. If set, attempts to delete this module will fail. Defaults to `false`.

public.description: Make this module publicly accessible. Can only be set at creation time. Defaults to `false`.

repository.description: Name of the repository, without the owner part

shared_accounts.description: List of the accounts (subdomains) which should have access to the Module

space_id.description: ID (slug) of the space the module is in

terraform_provider.description: The module provider will by default be inferred from the repository name if it follows the terraform-provider-name naming convention. However, if the repository doesn't follow this convention, or you gave the module a custom name, you can provide the provider name here.

worker_pool_id.description: ID of the worker pool to use. NOTE: worker_pool_id is required when using a self-hosted instance of Spacelift.

workflow_tool.description: Defines the tool that will be used to execute the workflow. This can be one of `OPEN_TOFU`, `TERRAFORM_FOSS` or `CUSTOM`. Defaults to `TERRAFORM_FOSS`.

id.description: ID of the Azure Devops integration. If not specified, the default integration will be used.

is_default.description: Indicates whether this is the default Azure DevOps integration

project.description: The name of the Azure DevOps project

block.description: Azure DevOps VCS settings

id.description: The ID of the Bitbucket Cloud integration. If not specified, the default integration will be used.

is_default.description: Indicates whether this is the default Bitbucket Cloud integration

namespace.description: The Bitbucket project containing the repository

block.description: Bitbucket Cloud VCS settings

id.description: The ID of the Bitbucket Datacenter integration. If not specified, the default integration will be used.

is_default.description: Indicates whether this is the default Bitbucket Datacenter integration

namespace.description: The Bitbucket project containing the repository

block.description: Bitbucket Datacenter VCS settings

id.description: The ID of the GitHub Enterprise integration. If not specified, the default integration will be used.

is_default.description: Indicates whether this is the default GitHub Enterprise integration

namespace.description: The GitHub organization / user the repository belongs to

block.description: GitHub Enterprise (self-hosted) VCS settings

id.description: ID of the Gitlab integration. If not specified, the default integration will be used.

is_default.description: Indicates whether this is the default GitLab integration

namespace.description: The GitLab namespace containing the repository

block.description: GitLab VCS settings

namespace.description: User-friendly namespace for the repository, this is for cosmetic purposes only

url.description: HTTPS URL of the Git repository

block.description: One-way VCS integration using a raw Git repository link
`spacelift_module` is a special type of a stack used to test and version Terraform modules.

content.description: Content of the mounted file encoded using Base-64

context_id.description: ID of the context on which the mounted file is defined

description.description: Free-form description of the mounted file

module_id.description: ID of the module on which the mounted file is defined

relative_path.description: Relative path to the mounted file, without the /mnt/workspace/ prefix

stack_id.description: ID of the stack on which the mounted file is defined

write_only.description: Indicates whether the content can be read back outside a Run. Defaults to `true`.

block.description: `spacelift_mounted_file` represents a file mounted in each Run's workspace that is part of a configuration of a context (`spacelift_context`), stack (`spacelift_stack`) or a module (`spacelift_module`). In principle, it's very similar to an environment variable (`spacelift_environment_variable`) except that the value is written to the filesystem rather than passed to the environment.

endpoint.description: endpoint to send the requests to

labels.description: labels for the webhook to use when referring in policies or filtering them

name.description: the name for the webhook which will also be used to generate the id

secret.description: secret used to sign each request so you're able to verify that the request comes from us. Defaults to an empty value. Note that once it's created, it will be just an empty string in the state due to security reasons.

space_id.description: ID of the space the webhook is in

block.description: `spacelift_named_webhook` represents a named webhook endpoint used for creating webhookswhich are referred to in Notification policies to route messages.

webhook_id.description: ID of the stack on which the environment variable is defined

block.description: `spacelift_named_webhook_secret_header` represents secret key value combination used as a custom headerwhen delivering webhook requests. It depends on `spacelift_named_webhook` resource which should exist.

name.description: Name of the policy - should be unique in one account

space_id.description: ID (slug) of the space the policy is in

type.description: Type of the policy. Possible values are `ACCESS`, `APPROVAL`, `GIT_PUSH`, `INITIALIZATION`, `LOGIN`, `PLAN`, `TASK`, `TRIGGER` and `NOTIFICATION`. Deprecated values are `STACK_ACCESS` (use `ACCESS` instead), `TASK_RUN` (use `TASK` instead), and `TERRAFORM_PLAN` (use `PLAN` instead).

block.description: `spacelift_policy` represents a Spacelift **policy** - a collection of customer-defined rules that are applied by Spacelift at one of the decision points within the application.

module_id.description: ID of the module to attach the policy to

policy_id.description: ID of the policy to attach

stack_id.description: ID of the stack to attach the policy to

block.description: `spacelift_policy_attachment` represents a relationship between a policy (`spacelift_policy`) and a stack (`spacelift_stack`) or module (`spacelift_module`). Each policy can only be attached to a stack/module once. `LOGIN` policies are the exception because they apply globally and not to individual stacks/modules. An attempt to attach one will fail.

commit_sha.description: The commit SHA for which to trigger a run.

id.description: The ID of the triggered run.

keepers.description: Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will trigger recreation of the resource.

proposed.description: Whether the run is a proposed run. Defaults to `false`.

stack_id.description: ID of the stack on which the run is to be triggered.

continue_on_state.description: Continue on the specified states of a finished run. If not specified, the default is `[ 'finished' ]`. You can use following states: `applying`, `canceled`, `confirmed`, `destroying`, `discarded`, `failed`, `finished`, `initializing`, `pending_review`, `performing`, `planning`, `preparing_apply`, `preparing_replan`, `preparing`, `queued`, `ready`, `replan_requested`, `skipped`, `stopped`, `unconfirmed`.

continue_on_timeout.description: Continue if run timed out, i.e. did not reach any defined end state in time. Default: `false`

disabled.description: Whether waiting for a job is disabled or not. Default: `false`

block.description: Wait for the run to finish
`spacelift_run` allows programmatically triggering runs in response to arbitrary changes in the keepers section.

created_by.description: Login of the user who created the saved filter

data.description: Data is the JSON representation of the filter data

id.description: Globally unique ID of the saved filter

is_public.description: Toggle whether the filter is public or not

type.description: Type describes the type of the filter. It is used to determine which view the filter is for. Possible values are `stacks`, `blueprints`, `contexts`, `webhooks`.

block.description: `spacelift_saved_filter` represents a Spacelift **filter** - a collection of customer-defined criteria that are applied by Spacelift at one of the decision points within the application.

at.description: Timestamp (unix timestamp) at which time the scheduling should happen.

delete_resources.description: Indicates whether the resources of the stack should be deleted.

stack_id.description: ID of the stack for which to set up scheduling

block.description: `spacelift_scheduled_delete_stack` represents a scheduling configuration for a Stack. It will trigger a stack deletion task at the given timestamp.

at.description: Timestamp (unix timestamp) at which time the scheduled run should happen.

every.description: List of cron schedule expressions based on which the scheduled run should be triggered.

next_schedule.description: Timestamp (unix timestamp) of when the next run will be scheduled.

stack_id.description: ID of the stack for which to set up the scheduled run

timezone.description: Timezone in which the schedule is expressed. Defaults to `UTC`.

project_root.description: Project root is the optional directory relative to the workspace root containing the entrypoint to the Stack.

runner_image.description: Name of the Docker image used to process Runs

terraform_workflow_tool.description: Defines the tool that will be used to execute the workflow. This can be one of `OPEN_TOFU`, `TERRAFORM_FOSS` or `CUSTOM`. Defaults to `TERRAFORM_FOSS`.

block.description: Environment variables for the run
Customer provided runtime configuration for this scheduled run.
`spacelift_scheduled_run` represents a scheduling configuration for a Stack. It will trigger a run on the given schedule or timestamp

at.description: Timestamp (unix timestamp) at which time the scheduled task should happen.

every.description: List of cron schedule expressions based on which the scheduled task should be triggered.

stack_id.description: ID of the stack for which to set up the scheduled task

timezone.description: Timezone in which the schedule is expressed. Defaults to `UTC`.

block.description: `spacelift_scheduled_task` represents a scheduling configuration for a Stack. It will trigger task on the given schedule or timestamp

email.description: Email address to which the security notifications are sent

block.description: `spacelift_security_email` represents an email address that receives notifications about security issues in Spacelift.

inherit_entities.description: indication whether access to this space inherits read access to entities from the parent space. Defaults to `false`.

labels.description: list of labels describing a space

parent_space_id.description: immutable ID (slug) of parent space. Defaults to `root`.

block.description:
`spacelift_space` represents a Spacelift **space** - a collection of resources such as stacks, modules, policies, etc. Allows for more granular access control. Can have a parent space.

**Please note:** the `spacelift_space` resource requires root Admin permissions, and can only be used by administrative stacks in the root space, or using an API key or user session that has root space access.

additional_project_globs.description: Project globs is an optional list of paths to track changes of in addition to the project root.

administrative.description: Indicates whether this stack can manage others. Defaults to `false`.

autodeploy.description: Indicates whether changes to this stack can be automatically deployed. Defaults to `false`.

autoretry.description: Indicates whether obsolete proposed changes should automatically be retried. Defaults to `false`.

aws_assume_role_policy_statement.description: AWS IAM assume role policy statement setting up trust relationship

branch.description: Git branch to apply changes to

enable_local_preview.description: Indicates whether local preview runs can be triggered on this Stack. Defaults to `false`.

enable_sensitive_outputs_upload.description: Indicates whether sensitive outputs created by this stack can be uploaded to Spacelift to be used by Stack Dependency references. Triggered only when corresponding option is enabled on the Worker Pool used by the Stack as well. Defaults to `true`.

enable_well_known_secret_masking.description: Indicates whether well-known secret masking is enabled.

github_action_deploy.description: Indicates whether GitHub users can deploy from the Checks API. Defaults to `true`. This is called allow run promotion in the UI.

import_state.description: State file to upload when creating a new stack

import_state_file.description: Path to the state file to upload when creating a new stack

manage_state.description: Determines if Spacelift should manage state for this stack. Defaults to `true`.

name.description: Name of the stack - should be unique in one account

project_root.description: Project root is the optional directory relative to the workspace root containing the entrypoint to the Stack.

protect_from_deletion.description: Protect this stack from accidental deletion. If set, attempts to delete this stack will fail. Defaults to `false`.

repository.description: Name of the repository, without the owner part

runner_image.description: Name of the Docker image used to process Runs

slug.description: Allows setting the custom ID (slug) for the stack

space_id.description: ID (slug) of the space the stack is in. Defaults to `legacy` if it exists, otherwise `root`.

terraform_external_state_access.description: Indicates whether you can access the Stack state file from other stacks or outside of Spacelift. Defaults to `false`.

terraform_smart_sanitization.description: Indicates whether runs on this will use terraform's sensitive value system to sanitize the outputs of Terraform state and plans in spacelift instead of sanitizing all fields. Note: Requires the terraform version to be v1.0.1 or above. Defaults to `false`.

terraform_workflow_tool.description: Defines the tool that will be used to execute the workflow. This can be one of `OPEN_TOFU`, `TERRAFORM_FOSS` or `CUSTOM`. Defaults to `TERRAFORM_FOSS`.

worker_pool_id.description: ID of the worker pool to use. NOTE: worker_pool_id is required when using a self-hosted instance of Spacelift.

block.description: Ansible-specific configuration. Presence means this Stack is an Ansible Stack.

id.description: The ID of the Azure Devops integration. If not specified, the default integration will be used.

is_default.description: Indicates whether this is the default Azure DevOps integration

project.description: The name of the Azure DevOps project

block.description: Azure DevOps VCS settings

id.description: The ID of the Bitbucket Cloud integration. If not specified, the default integration will be used.

is_default.description: Indicates whether this is the default Bitbucket Cloud integration

namespace.description: The Bitbucket project containing the repository

block.description: Bitbucket Cloud VCS settings

id.description: The ID of the Bitbucket Datacenter integration. If not specified, the default integration will be used.

is_default.description: Indicates whether this is the default Bitbucket Datacenter integration

namespace.description: The Bitbucket project containing the repository

block.description: Bitbucket Datacenter VCS settings

entry_template_file.description: Template file `cloudformation package` will be called on

template_bucket.description: S3 bucket to save CloudFormation templates to

block.description: CloudFormation-specific configuration. Presence means this Stack is a CloudFormation Stack.

id.description: The ID of the GitHub Enterprise integration. If not specified, the default integration will be used.

is_default.description: Indicates whether this is the default GitHub Enterprise integration

namespace.description: The GitHub organization / user the repository belongs to

block.description: VCS settings for [GitHub custom application](https://docs.spacelift.io/integrations/source-control/github#setting-up-the-custom-application)

id.description: The ID of the Gitlab integration. If not specified, the default integration will be used.

is_default.description: Indicates whether this is the default GitLab integration

namespace.description: The GitLab namespace containing the repository

block.description: GitLab VCS settings

kubernetes_workflow_tool.description: Defines the tool that will be used to execute the workflow. This can be one of `KUBERNETES` or `CUSTOM`. Defaults to `KUBERNETES`.

namespace.description: Namespace of the Kubernetes cluster to run commands on. Leave empty for multi-namespace Stacks.

block.description: Kubernetes-specific configuration. Presence means this Stack is a Kubernetes Stack.

login_url.description: State backend to log into on Run initialize.

stack_name.description: Pulumi stack name to use with the state backend.

block.description: Pulumi-specific configuration. Presence means this Stack is a Pulumi Stack.

namespace.description: User-friendly namespace for the repository, this is for cosmetic purposes only

url.description: HTTPS URL of the Git repository

block.description: One-way VCS integration using a raw Git repository link

terraform_version.description: The Terraform version. Must not be provided when tool is set to MANUALLY_PROVISIONED. Defaults to the latest available OpenTofu/Terraform version.

terragrunt_version.description: The Terragrunt version. Defaults to the latest Terragrunt version.

tool.description: The IaC tool used by Terragrunt. Valid values are OPEN_TOFU, TERRAFORM_FOSS or MANUALLY_PROVISIONED. Defaults to TERRAFORM_FOSS if not specified.

use_run_all.description: Whether to use `terragrunt run-all` instead of `terragrunt`.

use_smart_sanitization.description: Indicates whether runs on this will use Terraform's sensitive value system to sanitize the outputs of Terraform state and plans in spacelift instead of sanitizing all fields.

block.description: Terragrunt-specific configuration. Presence means this Stack is an Terragrunt Stack.

`spacelift_stack` combines source code and configuration to create a runtime environment where resources are managed. In this way it's similar to a stack in AWS CloudFormation, or a project on generic CI/CD platforms.

stack_id.description: ID of the stack to enable/disable

block.description: `spacelift_stack_activator` is used to to enable/disable Spacelift Stack.

duration_seconds.description: AWS IAM role session duration in seconds

external_id.description: Custom external ID (works only for private workers).

generate_credentials_in_worker.description: Generate AWS credentials in the private worker. Defaults to `false`.

module_id.description: ID of the module which assumes the AWS IAM role

region.description: AWS region to select a regional AWS STS endpoint.

role_arn.description: ARN of the AWS IAM role to attach

stack_id.description: ID of the stack which assumes the AWS IAM role

block.description:
~> **Note:** `spacelift_stack_aws_role` is deprecated. Please use `spacelift_aws_role` instead. The functionality is identical.

**NOTE:** while this resource continues to work, we have replaced it with the `spacelift_aws_integration` resource. The new resource allows integrations to be shared by multiple stacks/modules and also supports separate read vs write roles. Please use the `spacelift_aws_integration` resource instead.

`spacelift_stack_aws_role` represents [cross-account IAM role delegation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/tutorial_cross-account-with-roles.html) between the Spacelift worker and an individual stack or module. If this is set, Spacelift will use AWS STS to assume the supplied IAM role and put its temporary credentials in the runtime environment.

If you use private workers, you can also assume IAM role on the worker side using your own AWS credentials (e.g. from EC2 instance profile).

Note: when assuming credentials for **shared worker**, Spacelift will use `$accountName@$stackID` or `$accountName@$moduleID` as [external ID](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_create_for-user_externalid.html) and `$runID@$stackID@$accountName` truncated to 64 characters as [session ID](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/STS/latest/APIReference/API_AssumeRole).

depends_on_stack_id.description: immutable ID (slug) of stack to depend on.

stack_id.description: immutable ID (slug) of stack which has a dependency.

block.description: `spacelift_stack_dependency` represents a Spacelift **stack dependency** - a dependency between two stacks. When one stack depends on another, the tracked runs of the stack will not start until the dependent stack is successfully finished. Additionally, changes to the dependency will trigger the dependent.

input_name.description: Name of the input of the stack dependency reference

output_name.description: Name of the output of stack to depend on

trigger_always.description: Whether the dependents should be triggered even if the value of the reference did not change.

block.description: `spacelift_stack_dependency_reference` represents a Spacelift **stack dependency reference** - a reference matches a stack's output to another stack's input. It is similar to an environment variable (`spacelift_environment_variable`), except that value is provided by another stack's output.

deactivated.description: If set to true, destruction won't delete the stack

stack_id.description: ID of the stack to delete and destroy on destruction

block.description: `spacelift_stack_destructor` is used to destroy the resources of a Stack before deleting it. `depends_on` should be used to make sure that all necessary resources (environment variables, roles, integrations, etc.) are still in place when the destruction run is executed. **Note:** Destroying this resource will delete the resources in the stack. If this resource needs to be deleted and the resources in the stacks are to be preserved, ensure that the `deactivated` attribute is set to `true`.

module_id.description: ID of the module which uses GCP service account credentials

service_account_email.description: Email address of the GCP service account dedicated for this stack

stack_id.description: ID of the stack which uses GCP service account credentials

token_scopes.description: List of scopes that will be requested when generating temporary GCP service account credentials

block.description:
~> **Note:** `spacelift_stack_gcp_service_account` is deprecated. Please use `spacelift_gcp_service_account` instead. The functionality is identical.

`spacelift_stack_gcp_service_account` represents a Google Cloud Platform service account that's linked to a particular Stack or Module. These accounts are created by Spacelift on per-stack basis, and can be added as members to as many organizations and projects as needed. During a Run or a Task, temporary credentials for those service accounts are injected into the environment, which allows credential-less GCP Terraform provider setup.

init.description: Whether to initialize the stack or not. Default: `true`

keepers.description: Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will trigger recreation of the resource.

stack_id.description: ID of the stack for which to run the task

continue_on_state.description: Continue on the specified states of a finished run. If not specified, the default is `[ 'finished' ]`. You can use following states: `applying`, `canceled`, `confirmed`, `destroying`, `discarded`, `failed`, `finished`, `initializing`, `pending_review`, `performing`, `planning`, `preparing_apply`, `preparing_replan`, `preparing`, `queued`, `ready`, `replan_requested`, `skipped`, `stopped`, `unconfirmed`.

continue_on_timeout.description: Continue if task timed out, i.e. did not reach any defined end state in time. Default: `false`

disabled.description: Whether waiting for the task is disabled or not. Default: `false`

block.description: Wait for the run to finish
`spacelift_task` represents a task in Spacelift.

description.description: Free-form description for human users, supports Markdown

public.description: Whether the provider is public or not, defaults to false (private)

space_id.description: ID (slug) of the space the provider is in

type.description: Type of the provider - should be unique in one account

block.description: `spacelift_terraform_provider` represents a Terraform provider in Spacelift's own provider registry.

invitation_email.description: `invitation_email` will be used to send an invitation to the specified email address. This property is required when creating a new user. This property is optional when importing an existing user.

role.description: Type of access to the space. Possible values are: READ, WRITE, ADMIN

space_id.description: ID (slug) of the space the user has access to

block.description: `spacelift_user` represents a mapping between a Spacelift user (managed using an Identity Provider) and a Policy. A Policy defines what access rights the user has to a given Space.

config.description: VCS agent pool configuration, encoded using base64

description.description: Free-form VCS agent pool description for users

name.description: Name of the VCS agent pool, must be unique within an account

block.description: `spacelift_vcs_agent_pool` represents a Spacelift **VCS agent pool** - a logical group of proxies allowing Spacelift to access private VCS installations

commit_sha.description: The commit SHA for which to trigger a version.

id.description: The ID of the triggered version.

keepers.description: Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will trigger recreation of the resource.

module_id.description: ID of the module on which the version creation is to be triggered.

version_number.description: A semantic version number to set for the triggered version, example: 0.11.2

block.description: `spacelift_version` allows to programmatically trigger a module version creation in response to arbitrary changes in the keepers section.

enabled.description: enables or disables sending webhooks. Defaults to `true`.

endpoint.description: endpoint to send the POST request to

module_id.description: ID of the module which triggers the webhooks

secret.description: secret used to sign each POST request so you're able to verify that the request comes from us. Defaults to an empty value. Note that once it's created, it will be just an empty string in the state due to security reasons.

stack_id.description: ID of the stack which triggers the webhooks

block.description: `spacelift_webhook` represents a webhook endpoint to which Spacelift sends the POST request about run state changes.

config.description: credentials necessary to connect WorkerPool's workers to the control plane

csr.description: certificate signing request in base64. Changing this value will trigger a token reset.

space_id.description: ID (slug) of the space the worker pool is in

block.description: `spacelift_worker_pool` represents a worker pool assigned to the Spacelift account.

aws_account_id.description: the ID of the AWS account used by Spacelift for role assumption

block.description: `spacelift_account` represents the currently used Spacelift **account**

duration_seconds.description: Duration in seconds for which the assumed role credentials should be valid

external_id.description: Custom external ID (works only for private workers).

generate_credentials_in_worker.description: Generate AWS credentials in the private worker

integration_id.description: Immutable ID of the integration. Either `integration_id` or `name` must be specified.

name.description: Name of the AWS integration. Either `integration_id` or `name` must be specified.

region.description: AWS region to select a regional AWS STS endpoint.

role_arn.description: ARN of the AWS IAM role to attach

space_id.description: ID (slug) of the space the integration is in

block.description:
`spacelift_aws_integration` represents an integration with an AWS account. This integration is account-level and needs to be explicitly attached to individual stacks in order to take effect.

Note: when assuming credentials for **shared workers**, Spacelift will use `$accountName@$integrationID@$stackID@suffix` or `$accountName@$integrationID@$moduleID@$suffix` as [external ID](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_create_for-user_externalid.html) and `$runID@$stackID@$accountName` truncated to 64 characters as [session ID](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/STS/latest/APIReference/API_AssumeRole),$suffix will be `read` or `write`.

attachment_id.description: Internal ID of the attachment entity

integration_id.description: ID of the integration to attach

module_id.description: ID of the module to attach the integration to

read.description: Indicates whether this attachment is used for read operations

stack_id.description: ID of the stack to attach the integration to

write.description: Indicates whether this attachment is used for write operations

block.description: `spacelift_aws_integration_attachment` represents the attachment between a reusable AWS integration and a single stack or module.

assume_role_policy_statement.description: An assume role policy statement that can be attached to your role to allow Spacelift to assume it

external_id.description: The external ID that will be used during role assumption

integration_id.description: immutable ID (slug) of the AWS integration

module_id.description: immutable ID (slug) of the module

read.description: whether the integration will be used for read operations

stack_id.description: immutable ID (slug) of the stack

write.description: whether the integration will be used for write operations

block.description: `spacelift_aws_integration_attachment_external_id` is used to generate the external ID that would be used for role assumption when an AWS integration is attached to a stack or module.
`spacelift_aws_integrations` represents a list of all the AWS integrations in the Spacelift account visible to the API user.

duration_seconds.description: AWS IAM role session duration in seconds

external_id.description: Custom external ID (works only for private workers).

generate_credentials_in_worker.description: Generate AWS credentials in the private worker

module_id.description: ID of the module which assumes the AWS IAM role

region.description: AWS region to select a regional AWS STS endpoint.

role_arn.description: ARN of the AWS IAM role to attach

stack_id.description: ID of the stack which assumes the AWS IAM role

block.description:
`spacelift_aws_role` represents [cross-account IAM role delegation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/tutorial_cross-account-with-roles.html) between the Spacelift worker and an individual stack or module. If this is set, Spacelift will use AWS STS to assume the supplied IAM role and put its temporary credentials in the runtime environment.

If you use private workers, you can also assume IAM role on the worker side using your own AWS credentials (e.g. from EC2 instance profile).

Note: when assuming credentials for **shared worker**, Spacelift will use `$accountName@$stackID` or `$accountName@$moduleID` as [external ID](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_create_for-user_externalid.html) and `$runID@$stackID@$accountName` truncated to 64 characters as [session ID](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/STS/latest/APIReference/API_AssumeRole).

id.description: Azure DevOps integration id. If not provided, the default integration will be returned

space_id.description: Azure DevOps integration space id

vcs_checks.description: VCS checks configured for Azure DevOps repositories. Possible values: INDIVIDUAL, AGGREGATED, ALL. Defaults to INDIVIDUAL.

block.description: `spacelift_azure_devops_integration` returns details about Azure DevOps integration

admin_consent_provided.description: Indicates whether admin consent has been performed for the AAD Application.

admin_consent_url.description: The URL to use to provide admin consent to the application in the customer's tenant

application_id.description: The applicationId of the Azure AD application used by the integration.

default_subscription_id.description: The default subscription ID to use, if one isn't specified at the stack/module level

display_name.description: The display name for the application in Azure. This is automatically generated when the integration is created, and cannot be changed without deleting and recreating the integration.

integration_id.description: Immutable ID of the integration. Either `integration_id` or `name` must be specified.

labels.description: Labels to set on the integration

name.description: The friendly name of the integration. Either `integration_id` or `name` must be specified.

space_id.description: ID (slug) of the space the integration is in

block.description: `spacelift_azure_integration` represents an integration with an Azure AD tenant. This integration is account-level and needs to be explicitly attached to individual stacks in order to take effect. Note that you will need to provide admin consent manually for the integration to work

attachment_id.description: Internal ID of the attachment entity

integration_id.description: ID of the integration to attach

module_id.description: ID of the module to attach the integration to

read.description: Indicates whether this attachment is used for read operations

stack_id.description: ID of the stack to attach the integration to

subscription_id.description: Contains the Azure subscription ID to use with this Stack.  Overrides the default subscription ID set at the integration level.

write.description: Indicates whether this attachment is used for write operations

block.description: `spacelift_azure_integration_attachment` represents the attachment between a reusable Azure integration and a single stack or module.
`spacelift_azure_integrations` represents a list of all the Azure integrations in the Spacelift account visible to the API user.

id.description: Bitbucket Cloud integration id. If not provided, the default integration will be returned

space_id.description: Bitbucket Cloud integration space id

vcs_checks.description: VCS checks configured for Bitbucket Cloud repositories. Possible values: INDIVIDUAL, AGGREGATED, ALL. Defaults to INDIVIDUAL.

block.description: `spacelift_bitbucket_cloud_integration` returns details about Bitbucket Cloud integration

id.description: Bitbucket Datacenter integration id. If not provided, the default integration will be returned

space_id.description: Bitbucket Datacenter integration space id

user_facing_host.description: Bitbucket Datacenter integration user facing host

username.description: Username which will be used to authenticate requests for cloning repositories

vcs_checks.description: VCS checks configured for Bitbucket Datacenter repositories. Possible values: INDIVIDUAL, AGGREGATED, ALL. Defaults to INDIVIDUAL.

block.description: `spacelift_bitbucket_datacenter_integration` returns details about Bitbucket Datacenter integration

space_id.description: ID (slug) of the space the context is in

block.description: `spacelift_context` represents a Spacelift **context** - a collection of configuration elements (either environment variables or mounted files) that can be administratively attached to multiple stacks (`spacelift_stack`) or modules (`spacelift_module`) using a context attachment (`spacelift_context_attachment`)`

module_id.description: ID of the attached module

priority.description: Priority of the context attachment. All the contexts attached to a stack are sorted by priority (lowest first), though values don't need to be unique. This ordering establishes precedence rules between contexts should there be a conflict and multiple contexts define the same value.

stack_id.description: ID of the attached stack

block.description: `spacelift_context_attachment` represents a Spacelift attachment of a single context to a single stack or module, with a predefined priority.
Require contexts to have one of the labels
`spacelift_contexts` represents all the contexts in the Spacelift account visible to the API user.

inherit_entities.description: indication whether access to this space inherits read access to entities from the parent space

labels.description: list of labels describing a space

block.description: `spacelift_current_space` is a data source that provides information about the space that an administrative stack is in if the run is executed within Spacelift by a stack or module. This  makes it easier to create resources within the same space.

`spacelift_current_stack` is a data source that provides information about the current administrative stack if the run is executed within Spacelift by a stack or module. This allows clever tricks like attaching contexts or policies to the stack that manages them.

ignore_state.description: Controls whether drift detection should be performed on a stack in any final state instead of just 'Finished'.

reconcile.description: Whether a tracked run should be triggered when drift is detected.

schedule.description: List of cron schedule expressions based on which drift detection should be triggered.

stack_id.description: ID of the stack for which to set up drift detection

timezone.description: Timezone in which the schedule is expressed

block.description: `spacelift_drift_detection` represents a Drift Detection configuration for a Stack. It will trigger a proposed run on the given schedule, which you can listen for using run state webhooks. If reconcile is true, then a tracked run will be triggered when drift is detected.

context_id.description: ID of the context on which the environment variable is defined

module_id.description: ID of the module on which the environment variable is defined

stack_id.description: ID of the stack on which the environment variable is defined

write_only.description: indicates whether the value can be read back outside a Run

block.description: `spacelift_environment_variable` defines an environment variable on the context (`spacelift_context`), stack (`spacelift_stack`) or a module (`spacelift_module`), thereby allowing to pass and share various secrets and configuration with Spacelift stacks.

module_id.description: ID of the stack which uses GCP service account credentials

service_account_email.description: email address of the GCP service account dedicated for this stack

stack_id.description: ID of the stack which uses GCP service account credentials

block.description: `spacelift_gcp_service_account` represents a Google Cloud Platform service account that's linked to a particular Stack or Module. These accounts are created by Spacelift on per-stack basis, and can be added as members to as many organizations and projects as needed. During a Run or a Task, temporary credentials for those service accounts are injected into the environment, which allows credential-less GCP Terraform provider setup.

id.description: Github integration id. If not provided, the default integration will be returned

space_id.description: Github integration space id

vcs_checks.description: VCS checks configured for Github repositories. Possible values: INDIVIDUAL, AGGREGATED, ALL. Defaults to INDIVIDUAL.

block.description: `spacelift_github_enterprise_integration` returns details about Github Enterprise integration

id.description: Gitlab integration id. If not provided, the default integration will be returned

space_id.description: Gitlab integration space id

vcs_checks.description: VCS checks configured for GitLab repositories. Possible values: INDIVIDUAL, AGGREGATED, ALL. Defaults to INDIVIDUAL.

block.description: `spacelift_gitlab_integration` returns details about Gitlab integration
`spacelift_gitlab_webhook_endpoint` returns details about Gitlab webhook endpoint

cidrs.description: list of Spacelift IP addresses in CIDR notation (/32) for easy use in security group rules

ips.description: the list of spacelift.io outgoing IP addresses

block.description: `spacelift_ips` returns the list of Spacelift's outgoing IP addresses, which you can use to whitelist connections coming from the Spacelift's "mothership". **NOTE:** this does not include the IP addresses of the workers in Spacelift's public worker pool. If you need to ensure that requests made during runs originate from a known set of IP addresses, please consider setting up a [private worker pool](https://docs.spacelift.io/concepts/worker-pools).

administrative.description: indicates whether this module can administer others

aws_assume_role_policy_statement.description: AWS IAM assume role policy statement setting up trust relationship

branch.description: GitHub branch to apply changes to

description.description: free-form module description for human users (supports Markdown)

enable_local_preview.description: Indicates whether local preview versions can be triggered on this Module.

module_id.description: ID (slug) of the module

name.description: The module name will by default be inferred from the repository name if it follows the terraform-provider-name naming convention. However, if the repository doesn't follow this convention, or you want to give it a custom name, you can provide it here.

project_root.description: Project root is the optional directory relative to the repository root containing the module source code.

protect_from_deletion.description: Protect this module from accidental deletion. If set, attempts to delete this module will fail.

raw_git.description: One-way VCS integration using a raw Git repository link

repository.description: Name of the repository, without the owner part

shared_accounts.description: List of the accounts (subdomains) which should have access to the Module

space_id.description: ID (slug) of the space the module is in

terraform_provider.description: The module provider will by default be inferred from the repository name if it follows the terraform-provider-name naming convention. However, if the repository doesn't follow this convention, or you gave the module a custom name, you can provide the provider name here.

worker_pool_id.description: ID of the worker pool to use

workflow_tool.description: Defines the tool that will be used to execute the workflow. This can be one of `OPEN_TOFU`, `TERRAFORM_FOSS` or `CUSTOM`.

block.description: `spacelift_module` is a special type of a stack used to test and version Terraform modules.

content.description: content of the mounted file encoded using Base-64

context_id.description: ID of the context where the mounted file is stored

module_id.description: ID of the module where the mounted file is stored

relative_path.description: relative path to the mounted file

stack_id.description: ID of the stack where the mounted file is stored

write_only.description: indicates whether the value can be read back outside a Run

block.description: `spacelift_mounted_file` represents a file mounted in each Run's workspace that is part of a configuration of a context (`spacelift_context`), stack (`spacelift_stack`) or a module (`spacelift_module`). In principle, it's very similar to an environment variable (`spacelift_environment_variable`) except that the value is written to the filesystem rather than passed to the environment.

endpoint.description: endpoint to send the requests to

labels.description: labels for the webhook to use when referring in policies or filtering them

name.description: the name for the webhook which will also be used to generate the id

secret_header_keys.description: secret header keys which are currently set for this webhook

space_id.description: ID of the space the webhook is in

block.description: `spacelift_named_webhook` represents a named webhook endpoint used for creating webhookswhich are referred to in Notification policies to route messages.
`spacelift_policies` can find all policies that have certain labels.

space_id.description: ID (slug) of the space the policy is in

block.description: `spacelift_policy` represents a Spacelift **policy** - a collection of customer-defined rules that are applied by Spacelift at one of the decision points within the application.

created_by.description: Login of the user who created the saved filter

data.description: Data is the JSON representation of the filter data

id.description: Globally unique ID of the saved filter

is_public.description: Toggle whether the filter is public or not

type.description: Type describes the type of the filter. It is used to determine which view the filter is for

block.description: `spacelift_saved_filter` represents a Spacelift saved filter.
`spacelift_saved_filters` can find all saved filters that have certain type or name

at.description: Timestamp (unix timestamp) at which time the scheduling should happen.

delete_resources.description: Indicates whether the resources of the stack should be deleted.

stack_id.description: Stack ID of the scheduling config

block.description: `spacelift_scheduled_delete_stack` represents a scheduling configuration for a Stack. It will trigger a stack deletion task at the given timestamp.

at.description: Timestamp (unix timestamp) at which time the scheduled run should happen.

every.description: List of cron schedule expressions based on which the scheduled run should be triggered.

next_schedule.description: Timestamp (unix timestamp) of when the next run will be scheduled.

stack_id.description: Stack ID of the scheduling config

timezone.description: Timezone in which the schedule is expressed. Defaults to `UTC`.

project_root.description: Project root is the optional directory relative to the workspace root containing the entrypoint to the Stack.

runner_image.description: Name of the Docker image used to process Runs

terraform_workflow_tool.description: Defines the tool that will be used to execute the workflow. This can be one of `OPEN_TOFU`, `TERRAFORM_FOSS` or `CUSTOM`. Defaults to `TERRAFORM_FOSS`.

block.description: Environment variables for the run
Customer provided runtime configuration for this scheduled run.
`spacelift_scheduled_run` represents a scheduling configuration for a Stack. It will trigger a run on the given timestamp/schedule.

at.description: Timestamp (unix timestamp) at which time the scheduling should happen.

every.description: List of cron schedule expressions based on which the scheduled task should be triggered.

stack_id.description: Stack ID of the scheduled task

timezone.description: Timezone in which the schedule is expressed. Defaults to `UTC`.

block.description: `spacelift_scheduled_task` represents a scheduling configuration for a Stack. It will trigger a task on the given timestamp/schedule.

inherit_entities.description: indication whether access to this space inherits read access to entities from the parent space

labels.description: list of labels describing a space

space_id.description: immutable ID (slug) of the space

block.description: `spacelift_space` represents a Spacelift **space** - a collection of resources such as stacks, modules, policies, etc. Allows for more granular access control. Can have a parent space.

inherit_entities.description: indication whether access to this space inherits read access to entities from the parent space

labels.description: list of labels describing a space

space_path.description: path to the space - a series of space names separated by `/`

block.description:
`spacelift_space_by_path` represents a Spacelift **space** - a collection of resources such as stacks, modules, policies, etc. Allows for more granular access control. Can have a parent space. In contrary to `spacelift_space`, this resource is identified by a path, not by an ID. For this data source to work, path must be unique. If there are multiple spaces with the same path, this datasource will fail. 
This data source can be used either with absolute paths (starting with root) or relative paths. When using a relative path, the path is relative to the current run's space. 
**Disclaimer:** 
This datasource can only be used in a stack that resides in a space with inheritance enabled. In addition, the parent spaces (excluding root) must also have inheritance enabled.
`spacelift_spaces` can find all spaces in the spacelift organization.

additional_project_globs.description: Project globs is an optional list of paths to track changes of in addition to the project root.

administrative.description: indicates whether this stack can administer others

ansible.description: Ansible-specific configuration. Presence means this Stack is an Ansible Stack.

autodeploy.description: indicates whether changes to this stack can be automatically deployed

autoretry.description: indicates whether obsolete proposed changes should automatically be retried

aws_assume_role_policy_statement.description: AWS IAM assume role policy statement setting up trust relationship

branch.description: Repository branch to treat as the default 'main' branch

cloudformation.description: CloudFormation-specific configuration. Presence means this Stack is a CloudFormation Stack.

enable_local_preview.description: Indicates whether local preview runs can be triggered on this Stack.

enable_sensitive_outputs_upload.description: Indicates whether sensitive outputs created by this stack can be uploaded to Spacelift to be used by Stack Dependency references. Triggered only when corresponding option is enabled on the Worker Pool used by the Stack as well. Defaults to `true`.

enable_well_known_secret_masking.description: Indicates whether well-known secret masking is enabled.

kubernetes.description: Kubernetes-specific configuration. Presence means this Stack is a Kubernetes Stack.

manage_state.description: Determines if Spacelift should manage state for this stack

name.description: Name of the stack - should be unique in one account

project_root.description: Project root is the optional directory relative to the workspace root containing the entrypoint to the Stack.

protect_from_deletion.description: Protect this stack from accidental deletion. If set, attempts to delete this stack will fail.

pulumi.description: Pulumi-specific configuration. Presence means this Stack is a Pulumi Stack.

raw_git.description: One-way VCS integration using a raw Git repository link

repository.description: Name of the repository, without the owner part

runner_image.description: Name of the Docker image used to process Runs

space_id.description: ID (slug) of the space the stack is in

stack_id.description: ID (slug) of the stack

terraform_external_state_access.description: Indicates whether you can access the Stack state file from other stacks or outside of Spacelift.

terraform_smart_sanitization.description: Indicates whether runs on this will use terraform's sensitive value system to sanitize the outputs of Terraform state and plans in spacelift instead of sanitizing all fields.

terraform_workflow_tool.description: Defines the tool that will be used to execute the workflow. This can be one of `OPEN_TOFU`, `TERRAFORM_FOSS` or `CUSTOM`.

terragrunt.description: Terragrunt-specific configuration. Presence means this Stack is a Terragrunt Stack.

worker_pool_id.description: ID of the worker pool to use

block.description: `spacelift_stack` combines source code and configuration to create a runtime environment where resources are managed. In this way it's similar to a stack in AWS CloudFormation, or a project on generic CI/CD platforms.

duration_seconds.description: AWS IAM role session duration in seconds

external_id.description: Custom external ID (works only for private workers).

generate_credentials_in_worker.description: Generate AWS credentials in the private worker

module_id.description: ID of the module which assumes the AWS IAM role

region.description: AWS region to select a regional AWS STS endpoint.

role_arn.description: ARN of the AWS IAM role to attach

stack_id.description: ID of the stack which assumes the AWS IAM role

block.description:
~> **Note:** `spacelift_stack_aws_role` is deprecated. Please use `spacelift_aws_role` instead. The functionality is identical.

`spacelift_stack_aws_role` represents [cross-account IAM role delegation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/tutorial_cross-account-with-roles.html) between the Spacelift worker and an individual stack or module. If this is set, Spacelift will use AWS STS to assume the supplied IAM role and put its temporary credentials in the runtime environment.

If you use private workers, you can also assume IAM role on the worker side using your own AWS credentials (e.g. from EC2 instance profile).

Note: when assuming credentials for **shared worker**, Spacelift will use `$accountName@$stackID` or `$accountName@$moduleID` as [external ID](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_create_for-user_externalid.html) and `$runID@$stackID@$accountName` truncated to 64 characters as [session ID](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/STS/latest/APIReference/API_AssumeRole).

module_id.description: ID of the stack which uses GCP service account credentials

service_account_email.description: email address of the GCP service account dedicated for this stack

stack_id.description: ID of the stack which uses GCP service account credentials

block.description:
~> **Note:** `spacelift_stack_gcp_service_account` is deprecated. Please use `spacelift_gcp_service_account` instead. The functionality is identical.

`spacelift_stack_gcp_service_account` represents a Google Cloud Platform service account that's linked to a particular Stack or Module. These accounts are created by Spacelift on per-stack basis, and can be added as members to as many organizations and projects as needed. During a Run or a Task, temporary credentials for those service accounts are injected into the environment, which allows credential-less GCP Terraform provider setup.

stacks.description: List of stacks matching the predicates

block.description: Require stacks to be administrative or not
Require stacks to be on one of the branches
Require stacks to be on one of the commits
Require stacks to have one of the labels
Require stacks to be locked
Require stacks to have one of the names
Require stacks to be in one of the project roots
Require stacks to be in one of the repositories
Require stacks to have one of the states
Require stacks to use one of the IaC vendors
Require stacks to use one of the worker pools
`spacelift_stacks` represents all the stacks in the Spacelift account visible to the API user, matching predicates.

tool.description: The tool to get a list of supported versions for. This can be one of `KUBECTL`, `OPEN_TOFU`, `TERRAFORM_FOSS`, or `TERRAGRUNT`.

versions.description: Supported versions of the given tool.

block.description: Lists supported versions for a given tool.

description.description: Free-form VCS agent pool description for users

name.description: Name of the VCS agent pool

vcs_agent_pool_id.description: ID of the VCS agent pool to retrieve

block.description: `spacelift_vcs_agent_pool` represents a Spacelift **VCS agent pool** - a logical group of proxies allowing Spacelift to access private VCS installations
`spacelift_vcs_agent_pools` represents the VCS agent pools assigned to the Spacelift account.

endpoint.description: endpoint to send the POST request to

module_id.description: ID of the stack which triggers the webhooks

stack_id.description: ID of the stack which triggers the webhooks

block.description: `spacelift_webhook` represents a webhook endpoint to which Spacelift sends the POST request about run state changes.

config.description: credentials necessary to connect WorkerPool's workers to the control plane

space_id.description: ID (slug) of the space the worker pool is in

block.description: `spacelift_worker_pool` represents a worker pool assigned to the Spacelift account.
`spacelift_worker_pools` represents the worker pools assigned to the Spacelift account.
